hb.math.graph
Class Vertex

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--hb.math.graph.Vertex
Direct Known Subclasses:
Cluster, Variable
public class Vertex
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

A vertex is an element belonging to the vertex set V in a graph G=(V,E), where E is the edge-set where each edge-element connects two vertices.

See Also:
"[CorLeiRiv1990, pp86]", Graph, Edge

createVertices

public static java.util.Collection createVertices(java.lang.String vsstr)
Creates a Collection of vertices that are specified by the given string. The string should be in format "[A,B,C,...]" with or without the brackets.
Returns:
a Collection containing the vertices.

getColorString

public java.lang.String getColorString()
Gets the name of the color ("WHITE","GRAY","BLACK" or "UNKNOWN") of the vertex. These colors are set and used by different search algorithms performed on the graph G which the vertex belongs to.
Returns:
the type as a String.
See Also:
Graph
